intro: Grusonia emoryi, commonly known as Emory's grusonia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Grusonia emoryi is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, contributing to the ecological diversity of these regions.
